column142: Anxiety With These Key Foods, Drinks &amp
column143: Nutrients Depression and anxiety are as conventional as the common cold these days. Whether you've struggled with clinical depression or anxiety for years or have experienced bouts of one (or both) alongside stress or chronic illness, these neuropsychiatric disorders are all but unavoidable.Thanks to research on the gut-brain axis, scientists have found that our diet and overall gut health play a significant role in mental well-being—and an Antioxidants narrative review breaks down exactly which foods, drinks, and nutrients have been found to prevent and manage depression and anxiety symptoms. How diet can help prevent &amp
column145: anxiety Whether you've personally dealt with these neuropsychiatric disorders or have witnessed a family member, friend, or peer fight their own mental health battles, everyone is affected by depression and anxiety in some shape or form.Whole foods and nutrients like fish, coffee, tea, berries, omega-3 fatty acids, antioxidants (e.g., lycopene, resveratrol, selenium), and even dietary fiber have been found to play a critical role in the prevention and management of depression and anxiety.These nutrients and foods help promote mental well-being by: Foods, drinks, and nutrients for depression Pathologically, depression is often associated with inflammation in the brain, monoamine neurotransmitter deficiency, gut microbiota disorder, and HPA axis hyperactivity.Consumption of the following foods, drinks, and dietary nutrients have been found to lower the risk of depression and depressive symptoms in clinical trials: In animal studies, many common nutrients and supplement ingredients—including fish oil and omega-3s, navel orange and garlic essential oils, antioxidants (e.g., curcumin, lycopene, resveratrol, maqui berry, and EGCG), and various probiotic strains—have also been found to protect against and treat depressive mechanisms. Foods, drinks, and nutrients for anxiety According to the narrative review, anxiety is initiated and developed by oxidative stress, inflammation, and serotonergic and noradrenergic dysfunction (i.e., imbalances in serotonin and noradrenaline, aka norepinephrine)—but certain foods and nutrients can help.Consumption of the following foods, drinks, and dietary nutrients have been found to lower the risk of and protect against anxiety in clinical trials: In animal studies, a variety of foods, nutrients, and common supplement ingredients—such as honey, goat milk fat, breadfruit pulp, red pomegranate fruit extract, bergamot essential oil, omega-3s, phytonutrients (e.g., saffron, curcumin, and L-theanine), and various probiotic strains have also been found to reduce the prevalence and treat the effects of anxiety. The takeaway There are a number of neuroprotective foods, drinks, and nutrients you can add to your diet to help prevent and/or manage depression and anxiety. For an even easier solution, consider adding a quality supplement with one (or many!) of the ingredients listed above to your daily routine. column35: Anxiety With These Key Foods, Drinks &amp
column36:
Nutrients
Author:
Morgan Chamberlain
December 27, 2025
Former mbg Editor
By Morgan Chamberlain
Former mbg Editor
Morgan Chamberlain is mindbodygreen's former supplement editor. She graduated from Syracuse University with a Bachelor of Science degree in magazine journalism and a minor in nutrition.
Image by Pixel Stories / Stocksy
December 27, 2025

Depression and anxiety are as conventional as the common cold these days. Whether you've struggled with clinical depression or anxiety for years or have experienced bouts of one (or both) alongside stress or chronic illness, these neuropsychiatric disorders are all but unavoidable.

Thanks to research on the gut-brain axis, scientists have found that our diet and overall gut health play a significant role in mental well-being—and an Antioxidants narrative review breaks down exactly which foods, drinks, and nutrients have been found to prevent and manage depression and anxiety symptoms.

How diet can help prevent &
column38:
anxiety

Whether you've personally dealt with these neuropsychiatric disorders or have witnessed a family member, friend, or peer fight their own mental health battles, everyone is affected by depression and anxiety in some shape or form.

Whole foods and nutrients like fish, coffee, tea, berries, omega-3 fatty acids, antioxidants (e.g., lycopene, resveratrol, selenium), and even dietary fiber have been found to play a critical role in the prevention and management of depression and anxiety.

These nutrients and foods help promote mental well-being by:

  • Inhibiting inflammation
  • Fighting free radicals to reduce oxidative stress
  • Modulating
column39:
gut microbiota
  • Preventing hyperactivity of the hypothalamic–pituitary–adrenal (HPA) axis—i.e., the neuroendocrine mechanism that controls the body's reaction to stress
  • Supporting healthy levels of monoamine neurotransmitters (serotonin, dopamine, and norepinephrine), which play a key role in mood regulation

    • omega-3 potency+

    ★ ★ ★ ★ ★
    ★ ★ ★ ★ ★

    (58)

    Foods, drinks, and nutrients for depression

    Pathologically, depression is often associated with inflammation in the brain, monoamine neurotransmitter deficiency, gut microbiota disorder, and HPA axis hyperactivity.

    Consumption of the following foods, drinks, and dietary nutrients have been found to lower the risk of depression and depressive symptoms in clinical trials:

    • Fish
    • Fatty fish
    • Fatty fish
    • Mushroom fiber
    • Walnuts
    • Green tea
    • Tea
    • Coffee
    • Dietary fiber
    • Selenium

    In animal studies, many common nutrients and supplement ingredients—including fish oil and omega-3s, navel orange and garlic essential oils, antioxidants (e.g., curcumin, lycopene, resveratrol, maqui berry, and EGCG), and various probiotic strains—have also been found to protect against and treat depressive mechanisms.

    Foods, drinks, and nutrients for anxiety

    According to the narrative review, anxiety is initiated and developed by oxidative stress, inflammation, and serotonergic and noradrenergic dysfunction (i.e., imbalances in serotonin and noradrenaline, aka norepinephrine)—but certain foods and nutrients can help.

    Consumption of the following foods, drinks, and dietary nutrients have been found to lower the risk of and protect against anxiety in clinical trials:

    • Legumes and nuts
    • Dietary fiber
    • Omega-3 fatty acids
    • BCAAs
    • Vitamin B6

    In animal studies, a variety of foods, nutrients, and common supplement ingredients—such as honey, goat milk fat, breadfruit pulp, red pomegranate fruit extract, bergamot essential oil, omega-3s, phytonutrients (e.g., saffron, curcumin, and L-theanine), and various probiotic strains have also been found to reduce the prevalence and treat the effects of anxiety.

    The takeaway

    There are a number of neuroprotective foods, drinks, and nutrients you can add to your diet to help prevent and/or manage depression and anxiety. For an even easier solution, consider adding a quality supplement with one (or many!) of the ingredients listed above to your daily routine.

    omega-3 potency+

    ★ ★ ★ ★ ★

column1: /* Uncomment line below to reverse direction */

As seen in

Let’s hear it from the girls
column2: height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_1"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">
column3:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_2"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Jenna Finn

Katie’s workouts have seen me through being a first-time mom, another pregnancy, postpartum, and now exercising with my two little workout partners in tow. My son even said “Katie Austin” before he knew the names of his relatives! Whether I’m at the gym or pressed for time at home, I always have the perfect workout option— and recipes! Let’s not forget the recipes!
column5:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-1_3"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Hopkinton, MA
column6:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-1_6"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

""The variety of workouts is fantastic, and the daily calendar saves me so much time by providing fun and creative routines without any guesswork.""

Age 36

""The recipes amazing! They’re healthy but also really easy to make, which is perfect for someone with a busy lifestyle like mine. I don’t have time for complex meal prep, so having quick, nutritious recipes at my fingertips is a huge plus.""

Peonia Chan
column7:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-1_12"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

San Francisco, CA

Age 22

Plus, working out with Katie feels like exercising with a friend who’s there to cheer you on. It’s motivating and makes the whole process way more enjoyable. Overall, the app fits perfectly into my hectic life, helping me stay fit and healthy without the stress!!
column9: height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-1_17"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">
column10:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-1_18"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Victoria Lopez

I discovered Katie Austin workouts via YouTube when I was too afraid to face my fear and workout at the gym. Katie’s workout videos had me hooked and so excited to better my health! I have been to just about every gym or fitness studio, tried countless different virtual programs and nothing has stuck like the Katie Austin app. While I tend to get bored very easily and like to change it up, I love how I can either do a Katie Austin app quickie at home, outside, or challenge myself to do a quick core or ab workout in the sauna for an extra burn! The recipes are also amazing, but I’d be lying if I didn’t say that her workouts are my absolute favorite part about the app! Growing up overweight, diagnosed pre-diabetic at 17, and down almost 60 pounds to date- I always thought that you had to workout for hours a day and stay in a calorie deficit, but I’ve learned all you need is 20-30 minutes of movement a day and her videos are the *sweet spot* of activity you should do daily!
column11:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-1-1_3"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

San Antonio, TX

""Not only has the Katie Austin app been beneficial to my physical health: her message about not giving into diets or giving up the things you enjoy- but making healthier decisions and living a healthier lifestyle!""
column12:
Age 25

Becca Torrey

As a busy work from home sports mom, the KA Daily App is my absolute favorite way to workout. Her energy and realness is my favorite part of every workout. This program helped me lose over 30 lbs after having my third child, and it’s kept me in shape so I’m able to keep up with all of the activities being a sports mom entails. I tell everyone about this app because I love it so much and it’s made such a positive impact in my life.
column14:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-1-1_12"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Tuscon, AZ
column15:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-1-1_14"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

""Quick, efficient workouts that you can do literally anywhere.""

Age 34

Aly Rodriguez

I’m so happy I am apart of this amazing group and would love to share it with everyone! I was doing other apps and classes at studios but nothing had me hooked like Katie’s app. I love that the classes are under an hour so I can get my workout in but still sweat a ton!!! I love her personality and how she makes fitness so much fun. She’s super inspiring and I can really relate to her content.
column17:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-2_4"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Brea, CA
column18:
""I love all the recipes she has in the app! They are easy to follow, especially after a long day!""

Age 34

""The app has really kept me motivated! I love how many workouts there are to choose from and that you can schedule workouts if you want.""

Melissa Benko
column19:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-2_11"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Severn, MD

Age 41
column20:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-2_15"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

I have followed Katie for years and am so glad I tried the app. She always brings such a fun energy to her workouts and does a great job of explaining each move/what muscle groups are being targeted. I grew up with my mom working out to Denise Austin so it’s nice that now I get to workout with Katie.
column21:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-2_17"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Miranda Deakins

I love the Katie Austin app! I am currently working through the 28-day bridal glow series and I love that every single workout is broken down by day. She has all of them grouped together and when I get home from work I just throw on the app on my TV and do my workout for whatever is planned for that day.
column23:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-3_9"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Dallas, TX

""I became cancer free from Spinal Cancer through out my recovery process one of the things that motivated me was the Katie Austin App.""

Martha Luna
column24:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-3_13"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

New York City, NY

Age 41
column25:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-3_17"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

I’ve had the blessing to meet Katie since I’m an SI hopeful on her first year as a rookie and I’ve worked out with her in person. She’s fun and I love her energy in person so becoming part of the app while I was recovering home due that I had to relearned how to walk again and do the little things like tie my shoe lace or lay on my back I found this app so motivational and fun to do home.
column27:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-3_19"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

""These workouts are so challenging but Katie encourages you throughout the workout so it really does feel like you have a personal trainer right in your living room.""

Age 26

Brittany Meadows

As someone fortunate enough to workout with her in person at the KAA event in Nashville, to working out with her on my screen, Katie has the ability to make you feel seen whether she can actually see you or not. It feels like a one on one workout. She makes working out fun and light, but the impact is anything but simple. I’m always sore (in the best way) after a workout. Don’t let home workouts fool you - they mean business!
column28: Whether I am walking it out, working out, or whipping up Katie’s recipes in the kitchen, the Katie Austin app has me covered!
column29:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-desktop_review-1-2_3"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Nashville, TN

""Not every home workout program leaves you feeling stronger and accomplished, but the Katie Austin App absolutely does!""

Age 42

Jackson Moehler

As a former D1 athlete like Katie, I appreciate how she explains every move and why it works. I saw a noticeable difference in my body just weeks after adding her workout routines into my day. She is such a bright light and brings that to her workouts which makes them so fun!

This program helped me lose over 30 lbs after having my third child, and it’s kept me in shape so I’m able to keep up with all of the activities being a sports mom entails. I tell everyone about this app because I love it so much and it’s made such a positive impact in my life.

Miranda Deakins, 26

""These workouts are so challenging but Katie encourages you throughout the workout so it really does feel like you have a personal trainer right in your living room.""
column53:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-mobile_miranda_4"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Dallas, TX

I love the Katie Austin app! I am currently working through the 28-day bridal glow series and I love that every single workout is broken down by day. She has all of them grouped together and when I get home from work I just throw on the app on my TV and do my workout for whatever is planned for that day.

height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-mobile_miranda_7"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

Martha Luna, 41

""I became cancer free from Spinal Cancer through out my recovery process one of the things that motivated me was the Katie Austin App.""
column56:
height:100%"" data-img=""testimonies-mobile_martha_4"" class=""se-img se-gr slzy"">

New York City, NY

I’ve had the blessing to meet Katie since I’m an SI hopeful on her first year as a rookie and I’ve worked out with her in person. She’s fun and I love her energy in person so becoming part of the app while I was recovering home due that I had to relearned how to walk again and do the little things like tie my shoe lace or lay on my back I found this app so motivational and fun to do home.
